oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1953-04-25 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from April 25, 1953. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), George Morgan (host/performer), guest performer Hank Thompson and his Brazos Valley Boys, and regular performers Minnie Pearl, Tommy Jackson, Lew Childre, the Old Hickory Singers, Rod Brasfield, and Stringbean. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that the Carter Sisters will be the guest the following week.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: George Morgan; Minnie Pearl; Hank Thompson; Brazos Valley Boys; Tommy Jackson; Lew Childre; Old Hickory Singers
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: NBC special bulletin -- Grant Turner introduces George Morgan -- Easy Rockin' Chair (George Morgan) -- Opening statement (George Morgan, Grant Turner) -- George Morgan introduces Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl, George Morgan) -- Prince Albert commercial (George Morgan, Grant Turner) -- George Morgan introduces Hank Thompson -- No Help Wanted (Hank Thompson and his Brazos Valley Boys) -- George Morgan introduces Tommy Jackson and Lew Childre -- Bill Cheatham (Tommy Jackson fiddle, Lew Childre calls) -- George Morgan talks -- Open Thy Merciful Arms (George Morgan) -- Prince Albert commercial (George Morgan, Grant Turner) -- Prince Albert jingle (Old Hickory Singers) -- George Morgan introduces the Old Hickory Singers
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Morgan, George, 1925-1975; Martin, Grady, 1929-; Sharpe, Claude, 1902-1969; Old Hickory Singers; Minnie Pearl; Brasfield, Rod; Stringbean, 1915-1973; Thompson, Hank; Brazos Valley Boys; Jackson, Tommy; Childre, Lew, 1901-1961
